description: A protocol that defines non-compliance with AGENTS.md and specifies corrective actions.

rules.description: Defines non-compliance as a violation of any rule, convention, or procedure in AGENTS.md or its source protocols.
rules.enforcement: This is a definitional rule. Enforcement is achieved through the agent's adherence to the specific non-compliance rules that follow.

rules.description: Prohibits the direct editing of build artifacts like AGENTS.md or README.md. Changes must be made to source files, followed by a rebuild.
rules.enforcement: Agent must revert direct edits and modify source files, then run the appropriate build command.

rules.description: Requires adherence to all documented testing procedures before submitting changes.
rules.enforcement: Agent must halt execution and run the required tests, debugging any failures before proceeding.

rules.description: Forbids changes that contradict documented architectural patterns or coding conventions.
rules.enforcement: Agent must revert non-compliant changes and re-implement them according to standards.

rules.description: Requires the agent to maintain an up-to-date understanding of protocols by recompiling AGENTS.md when necessary.
rules.enforcement: Agent should run 'make AGENTS.md' to refresh its protocol knowledge and re-evaluate its plan.
